articles.title: A loud minority makes the Internet look far more toxic than it is
articles.summary: People think online platforms are overflowing with toxic and misleading content, but the reality is far calmer. A small group of highly active users creates most of the harm, while the majority remain relatively civil. Still, many Americans assume the worst about each other because of this imbalance. Correcting that belief can noticeably improve how people feel about society.
articles.content:
Americans tend to believe that online spaces are far more hostile than they actually are. Many assume that nearly half of people on major platforms regularly post cruel, aggressive, or abusive comments. In reality, truly severe online toxicity is much rarer. One striking example is Reddit, where Americans estimate that 43% of users post highly toxic comments, even though research shows the real figure is closer to just 3%. This gap between perception and reality can quietly fuel a broader sense of pessimism about other people and about society as a whole.

To better understand this disconnect, researchers Angela Y. Lee, Eric Neumann, and their colleagues surveyed 1,090 American adults using the online research platform CloudResearch Connect. The goal was to compare what people believe about harmful online behavior with actual data collected in previous large-scale studies of social media platforms.

The results showed that people dramatically overestimate how common toxic behavior is. On Reddit, participants believed toxic commenters were 13 times more common than they truly are. A similar pattern appeared on Facebook. Participants guessed that 47% of users share false or misleading news stories, even though existing research suggests the real number is about 8.5%. In other words, people assume that misinformation and harmful content dominate social media feeds far more than they actually do.

Recognizing Toxic Content Does Not Fix the Misbelief

Interestingly, this inflated perception was not simply due to confusion about what counts as toxic content. In a signal detection task, a type of psychological test used to measure how accurately people can identify specific signals amid noise, many participants correctly recognized examples of toxic online posts. Even so, they still believed that a large share of users regularly produce such content.

This suggests that the problem is not an inability to spot harmful behavior, but a mistaken belief about how widespread it is. People may remember extreme posts more vividly or encounter them more often because social media algorithms amplify attention grabbing content, leading them to assume that such behavior is the norm.

How Correcting the Misperception Changes Attitudes

The researchers also tested whether changing these beliefs could influence how people feel about society. In an experiment, participants were shown accurate information about how rare severe online toxicity actually is. Afterward, many reported feeling more optimistic and less concerned that society is in moral decline. They were also less likely to believe that most Americans are comfortable with harmful or aggressive online behavior.

According to the authors, people often confuse a very small but extremely vocal group of users with the majority. A limited number of highly active accounts produce most toxic and harmful content, creating the illusion that it reflects widespread attitudes. Recognizing this distinction may help reduce the negative emotional effects associated with social media and could improve social cohesion by reminding people that most users are not behaving badly online.
articles.reasoning: The article reveals a positive and hopeful insight that online toxicity is far less widespread than commonly believed, which can improve societal attitudes and reduce pessimism. It highlights research correcting misconceptions about social media behavior, showing that a small vocal minority causes most harm, and that correcting these misperceptions can foster optimism and social cohesion. This has meaningful societal impact by potentially improving mental well-being and public perception of social media environments.
articles.personality_title: Most online toxicity comes from a small, loud group, not the majority
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context** – Many people think the internet is full of mean, harmful, or misleading posts. They believe that a large number of users behave badly online, making social media seem very toxic.

**What happened** – Researchers surveyed over 1,000 American adults to compare their beliefs about online toxicity with real data. They found that people greatly overestimate how many users post harmful or false content. For example, on Reddit, people guessed 43% of users post toxic comments, but the true number is about 3%. On Facebook, people thought 47% share false news, while the real figure is closer to 8.5%.

**Impact** – This shows that most online spaces are calmer than people assume. The loudest harmful voices come from a small, active group, not the majority. When people learned the truth, they felt more hopeful about society and less worried about moral decline. This understanding can help reduce negative feelings caused by social media and improve how people see each other.

**What’s next step** – Sharing accurate information about online behavior could help more people see that most users are respectful and kind. This may lead to better mental well-being and stronger social connections, as people stop assuming the worst about others online.

**One-sentence takeaway** – A small number of users cause most online toxicity, and knowing this can help people feel more positive about social media and society.
articles.personality_title_fr: La majorité silencieuse en ligne est bien plus respectueuse que ce que l’on croit
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte** – Beaucoup de gens pensent qu’Internet est rempli de messages méchants, nuisibles ou trompeurs. Ils croient qu’un grand nombre d’utilisateurs se comportent mal en ligne, ce qui donne l’impression que les réseaux sociaux sont très toxiques.

**Ce qui s’est passé** – Des chercheurs ont interrogé plus de 1 000 adultes américains pour comparer leurs croyances sur la toxicité en ligne avec des données réelles. Ils ont découvert que les gens surestiment largement le nombre d’utilisateurs qui publient du contenu nuisible ou faux. Par exemple, sur Reddit, les gens pensaient que 43 % des utilisateurs publient des commentaires toxiques, alors que le vrai chiffre est d’environ 3 %. Sur Facebook, ils croyaient que 47 % partagent de fausses informations, alors que le chiffre réel est proche de 8,5 %.

**Impact** – Cela montre que la plupart des espaces en ligne sont plus calmes que ce que l’on imagine. Les voix nuisibles les plus fortes viennent d’un petit groupe actif, pas de la majorité. Quand les gens ont appris la vérité, ils se sont sentis plus optimistes pour la société et moins inquiets d’un déclin moral. Cette compréhension peut aider à réduire les sentiments négatifs causés par les réseaux sociaux et améliorer la manière dont les gens se perçoivent.

**Prochaine étape** – Diffuser des informations précises sur le comportement en ligne pourrait aider plus de personnes à voir que la plupart des utilisateurs sont respectueux et gentils. Cela pourrait améliorer le bien-être mental et renforcer les liens sociaux, car les gens cesseraient de penser le pire des autres en ligne.

**Résumé en une phrase** – Un petit nombre d’utilisateurs cause la majorité de la toxicité en ligne, et savoir cela peut aider les gens à voir les réseaux sociaux et la société de manière plus positive.
articles.personality_title_es: La mayoría en línea es mucho más respetuosa de lo que se piensa
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto** – Muchas personas creen que Internet está lleno de mensajes malos, dañinos o engañosos. Piensan que un gran número de usuarios se comporta mal en línea, haciendo que las redes sociales parezcan muy tóxicas.

**Qué pasó** – Investigadores encuestaron a más de 1,000 adultos estadounidenses para comparar sus creencias sobre la toxicidad en línea con datos reales. Descubrieron que la gente sobreestima mucho cuántos usuarios publican contenido dañino o falso. Por ejemplo, en Reddit, la gente pensaba que el 43 % de los usuarios publicaba comentarios tóxicos, pero el número real es cerca del 3 %. En Facebook, creían que el 47 % compartía noticias falsas, pero la cifra real es alrededor del 8.5 %.

**Impacto** – Esto muestra que la mayoría de los espacios en línea son más tranquilos de lo que se cree. Las voces dañinas más fuertes vienen de un pequeño grupo activo, no de la mayoría. Cuando las personas conocieron la verdad, se sintieron más optimistas sobre la sociedad y menos preocupadas por un declive moral. Esta comprensión puede ayudar a reducir sentimientos negativos causados por las redes sociales y mejorar cómo se ven unas a otras las personas.

**Próximo paso** – Compartir información precisa sobre el comportamiento en línea podría ayudar a más personas a ver que la mayoría de los usuarios son respetuosos y amables. Esto podría mejorar el bienestar mental y fortalecer las conexiones sociales, ya que la gente dejaría de asumir lo peor de los demás en línea.

**Frase resumen** – Un pequeño número de usuarios causa la mayoría de la toxicidad en línea, y saber esto puede ayudar a las personas a sentirse más positivas sobre las redes sociales y la sociedad.

articles.title: Bank of England expected to cut interest rates
articles.summary: Analysts believe the Bank rate will fall from 4% to 3.75%, lowering the cost of borrowing.
articles.content:
Bank of England expected to cut interest rates

5 hours ago Share Save Kevin Peachey Cost of living correspondent Share Save

Getty Images

Policymakers at the Bank of England are expected to cut interest rates - bringing the Bank rate down to its lowest level since February 2023. Analysts are widely predicting a fall from 4% to 3.75%, although they do not expect a unanimous decision among the nine-member Monetary Policy Committee (MPC). This would be the sixth cut in interest rates from August last year. The Bank rate heavily influences the cost of borrowing by consumers, but also the returns given to savers.

The MPC has a target to keep inflation - which charts the rising cost of living - to 2%. The Bank rate is the committee's primary tool for achieving its ambition. The latest inflation data, published on Wednesday, showed a bigger drop to Consumer Prices Index (CPI) inflation than analysts had been expecting. The rate of CPI fell to 3.2% in November, from 3.6% in October, the Office for National Statistics (ONS) said.

While inflation remains above the Bank's target, the latest fall in the rate and signs of rising unemployment and a relatively stagnant economy are likely to push the committee towards an interest rate cut. At the previous meeting in November, the four members of the MPC who voted for a cut were only just outvoted by the five who wanted to keep rates on hold. At the time, the Bank's governor, Andrew Bailey, said he would "prefer to wait and see" whether inflation continued to drop back. James Smith, developed market economist for ING, said the sharp drop in the November rate of inflation "green lights" a rate cut. He said the "latest drop in inflation fits into a broader body of evidence suggesting that price pressures are cooling". He is forecasting another two cuts to interest rates in February and April next year, although not all analysts agree with this suggestion.

Impact on borrowing and savings
articles.reasoning: The expected cut in Bank of England interest rates signals potential relief for borrowers by lowering borrowing costs, which can positively impact the economy and individuals facing financial strain. The article provides sufficient context on inflation trends and economic indicators supporting this decision, indicating a meaningful policy move with broad societal implications.
articles.personality_title: Bank of England likely to lower interest rates for first time in months
articles.personality_presentation:
**Context** – The Bank of England controls the main interest rate that affects how much it costs people to borrow money or how much savers earn. This rate also helps manage inflation, which is how fast prices rise over time.

**What happened** – Analysts expect the Bank of England to reduce its interest rate from 4% to 3.75%. This would be the sixth time rates have been lowered since August last year. The decision comes after new data showed inflation dropped more than expected in November, going from 3.6% to 3.2%.

**Impact** – Lowering the interest rate means borrowing money, like loans or mortgages, could become cheaper. This can help people who need to borrow and might ease financial pressure. However, savers might earn less on their savings. The move also shows that inflation is starting to slow down, which is a sign the economy might be stabilizing.

**What's next step** – Some experts think there could be two more rate cuts early next year, in February and April. But not everyone agrees, so future decisions will depend on how inflation and the economy change.

**One-sentence takeaway** – The Bank of England plans to lower interest rates to ease borrowing costs as inflation shows signs of slowing down.
articles.personality_title_fr: La Banque d'Angleterre devrait baisser ses taux d'intérêt pour la première fois depuis des mois
articles.personality_presentation_fr:
**Contexte** – La Banque d'Angleterre contrôle le taux d'intérêt principal qui influence le coût des emprunts et les gains des épargnants. Ce taux aide aussi à gérer l'inflation, c’est-à-dire la vitesse à laquelle les prix augmentent.

**Ce qui s’est passé** – Les analystes s'attendent à ce que la Banque d'Angleterre réduise son taux d'intérêt de 4 % à 3,75 %. Ce serait la sixième baisse depuis août dernier. Cette décision suit des données montrant que l'inflation a baissé plus que prévu en novembre, passant de 3,6 % à 3,2 %.

**Impact** – Baisser le taux d'intérêt signifie que les emprunts, comme les prêts ou les hypothèques, pourraient coûter moins cher. Cela peut aider les personnes ayant besoin d'emprunter et réduire leur pression financière. En revanche, les épargnants pourraient gagner moins sur leurs économies. Cette décision montre aussi que l'inflation commence à ralentir, signe que l'économie pourrait se stabiliser.

**Prochaine étape** – Certains experts pensent qu'il pourrait y avoir deux autres baisses de taux début l'année prochaine, en février et avril. Mais tout le monde n'est pas d'accord, donc les décisions dépendront de l'évolution de l'inflation et de l'économie.

**Résumé en une phrase** – La Banque d'Angleterre prévoit de baisser les taux d'intérêt pour alléger le coût des emprunts alors que l'inflation montre des signes de ralentissement.
articles.personality_title_es: El Banco de Inglaterra probablemente reducirá las tasas de interés por primera vez en meses
articles.personality_presentation_es:
**Contexto** – El Banco de Inglaterra controla la tasa de interés principal que afecta cuánto cuesta pedir dinero prestado o cuánto ganan los ahorradores. Esta tasa también ayuda a controlar la inflación, que es la velocidad a la que suben los precios.

**Qué pasó** – Los analistas esperan que el Banco de Inglaterra baje su tasa de interés del 4 % al 3.75 %. Esta sería la sexta reducción desde agosto del año pasado. La decisión llega después de que datos recientes mostraron que la inflación bajó más de lo esperado en noviembre, pasando del 3.6 % al 3.2 %.

**Impacto** – Bajar la tasa de interés significa que pedir préstamos, como créditos o hipotecas, podría ser más barato. Esto puede ayudar a las personas que necesitan pedir dinero y aliviar su carga financiera. Sin embargo, los ahorradores podrían ganar menos con sus ahorros. La medida también muestra que la inflación comienza a desacelerarse, una señal de que la economía podría estabilizarse.

**Próximo paso** – Algunos expertos creen que podría haber dos recortes más en las tasas a principios del próximo año, en febrero y abril. Pero no todos están de acuerdo, por lo que las decisiones futuras dependerán de cómo cambien la inflación y la economía.

**Resumen en una frase** – El Banco de Inglaterra planea bajar las tasas de interés para reducir el costo de los préstamos mientras la inflación muestra señales de desaceleración.
